==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|alt1=亲|辛|t1=hazelnut tree|斤|t2=axe|ls=psc|c1=p|c2=s}} – to cut down a tree with an axe (hence starting something new).

Also {{liushu|ic|nocap=1}}. Original form of {{och-l|薪|firewood}}.

===Etymology===
Sino-Tibetan; cognate with {{cog|my|သစ်||new}}. Compare the cognacy between {{och-l|薪|firewood}} and {{cog|my|သစ်||wood; timber}}.

This word may belong to the Sino-Tibetan stem {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s-riŋ ~ s-r(j)aŋ|*siŋ|alive, fresh, green}} and may hence be related to {{och-l|青|green}} as well as {{och-l|薪|firewood}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).
